subject: Philosophy
title: The Middle Way
description: A quick win: understand The Middle Way.

hook.text: Before enlightenment, the Buddha nearly starved himself to death through extreme fasting.

buildup.text: He had tried luxury in a palace and deprivation in the forest. Neither worked.

discovery.text: The Middle Way avoids both extremes: neither indulgence nor self-torture leads to wisdom.

twist.text: It sounds obvious, but extremism is humanity's default. We oscillate between excess and denial.

climax.text: The Middle Way applies beyond religion â€” to diet, work, politics, and daily living.

quiz.question: What does the Middle Way reject?
options: Both extreme indulgence and extreme asceticism
